com.skobbler.ngx.map

Class SKMapSurfaceView

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.view.View
      • android.view.SurfaceView
        • android.opengl.GLSurfaceView
          • com.skobbler.ngx.map.SKMapSurfaceView
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.graphics.drawable.Drawable.Callback, android.opengl.GLSurfaceView.EGLConfigChooser, android.view.accessibility.AccessibilityEventSource, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, android.view.SurfaceHolder.Callback, java.util.Observer

    public class SKMapSurfaceView
extends android.opengl.GLSurfaceView
implements android.opengl.GLSurfaceView.EGLConfigChooser, java.util.Observer
    Class that constructs a map surface view. Any call to this call must be done only after SKMapSurfaceListener.onSurfaceCreated() was notified.
    Version:
    2.4

      • preserveGLContext

        public static boolean preserveGLContext
        Default value is true. If multiple map instances need to be supported then this has to be set to false before setContentView is called for the layout containing the first map . This can be done once when starting the application.

      • addAnnotation

        public void addAnnotation(SKAnnotation annotation,
                 SKAnimationSettings animationSettings)
        Adds an annotation.
        Parameters:
        annotation - model object of the annotation. For further details see SKAnnotation
        animationSettings - animation settings for adding the annottion.

        There are four types of annotations that can be added :

        1. Annotation using texture id , from the json file ( see daystyle.json): 
          
                 final SKAnnotation annotation = new SKAnnotation();
                 annotation.setUniqueID(uniqueID);
                 annotation.getLocation().setLongitude(23.591161);
                 annotation.getLocation().setLatitude(46.771367);
                 annotation.setAnnotationType(SKAnnotation.SK_ANNOTATION_TYPE_PURPLE);
                 mapView.addAnnotation(annotation, SKAnimationSettings.ANIMATION_POP_OUT);
        2. Annotation using an absolute path for the image file :
          
                 final SKAnnotation annotation = new SKAnnotation();
                 annotation.setUniqueID(uniqueID);
                 annotation.getLocation().setLongitude(23.593701);
                 annotation.getLocation().setLatitude(46.774959);
                 annotation.getOffset().setX(64);
                 annotation.getOffset().setY(64);
                 annotation.setImagePath(SKMaps.getInstance().getMapInitSettings()
                                 .getMapResourcesPath()
                                 + "/.Common/ccpmedium_2d_retina.png");
                 annotation.setImageSize(128);
                 mapView.addAnnotation(annotation,
                                 SKAnimationSettings.ANIMATION_PIN_DROP);
        3. Annotation using a drawable resource id : 
             
                final SKAnnotation annotation = new SKAnnotation();
                annotation.setUniqueID(uniqueID);
                annotation.getLocation().setLongitude(23.591451);
                annotation.getLocation().setLatitude(46.772821);
                // center point of the image - tapping on an annotation will depend on
                // this value . Also the actual gps coordinates of the annotation will
                // be in the center of the image.
                 annotation.setOffset(new SKScreenPoint(64, 64));
 
                final SKAnnotationView annotationView = new SKAnnotationView();
                annotationView.setDrawableResourceId(drawableResId);
                // width and height of the image in pixels.
                annotationView.setWidth(128);
                annotationView.setHeight(128);
                annotation.setAnnotationView(annotationView);
                mapView.addAnnotation(annotation, SKAnimationSettings.ANIMATION_PIN_DROP);
        4. Annotation using a custom view: 
             
               final SKAnnotation annotation = new SKAnnotation();
               annotation.setUniqueID(uniqueID);
               annotation.setMininumZoomLevel(5);
               annotation.getLocation().setLongitude(23.598897)
               annotation.getLocation().setLatitude(46.770286);
 
               final SKAnnotationView annotationView = new SKAnnotationView();
               annotationView.setView(view);
               annotation.setAnnotationView(annotationView);
               mapView.addAnnotation(annotation,SKAnimationSettings.ANIMATION_PIN_DROP);

      • updateAnnotation

        public void updateAnnotation(SKAnnotation annotation)
        Updates an existing annotation.
        Parameters:
        annotation - the annotation that needs to be updated.

        Please check addAnnotation(SKAnnotation, SKAnimationSettings) to see what types of annotations can be added/updated and what fields have to be set for each type of annotation.

        Parameters:

      • requestScreenshot

        public void requestScreenshot()
        Requests a bitmap to be constructed from the map the next time it will be rendered.

      • getScreenshot

        public android.graphics.Bitmap getScreenshot()
        Returns the map screenshot as a bitmap. Example of how to get the screenshot: 
         {
     @code
     mapView.setDrawingCacheBackgroundColor(Color.TRANSPARENT);
     mapView.requestScreenshot();
     synchronized (mapView) {
         mapView.requestRender();
         try {
             mapView.wait();
             mapBitmap = mapView.getScreenshot();
         } catch (final InterruptedException e) {
             e.printStackTrace();
             return null;
         }
     }
 }
        Returns:
        the resulted screenshot

      • addPolygon

        public boolean addPolygon(SKPolygon polygon)
        Adds the specified polygon on the map. In case a large number of polygons need to be drawn in a loop, the performance may be improved by including the loop in the GL thread (using GLSurfaceView.queueEvent()).
        Parameters:
        polygon - stores all the information about the polygon.
        Returns:
        true, if the operation succeeded

      • addCircle

        public boolean addCircle(SKCircle circle)

        Parameters:
        circle - stores all the information about the circle.
        Returns:
        true, if the operation succeeded
